update.description:
## Purpose

SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model. It only needs bounding box information at the model level. This PR *should* handle both link and model bounding boxes.

What I'm most unhappy about is the calculation of bounding information every iteration. We can live with this for the Acropolis release, but I'm open to other alternatives.

## Required PRs

These required PRs have all been merged.

* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/68~~
* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/91~~

## Testing

1. Run the shapes world: `ign-gazebo-server -r -f shapes.world -v 4`
2. Call the model info service: 

```
ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 2000 --req 'data: "box"'
```
update.title: [Acropolis] Bounding box info

content.raw: The service is currently always returning the default invalid box because the message is only being set the moment the entity is created (`EachNew`) and physics hasn't calculated the box yet.
content.html: The service is currently always returning the default invalid box because the message is only being set the moment the entity is created (EachNew) and physics hasn't calculated the box yet.

content.raw: Actually, the whole model service is not returning proper values because the model messages are not being updated at every iteration, so the fix will require updating the model message that is stored in the graph at every iteration.
content.html: Actually, the whole model service is not returning proper values because the model messages are not being updated at every iteration, so the fix will require updating the model message that is stored in the graph at every iteration.

update.description:
## Purpose

SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model. It only needs bounding box information at the model level. This PR *should* handle both link and model bounding boxes.

What I'm most unhappy about is the calculation of bounding information every iteration. We can live with this for the Acropolis release, but I'm open to other alternatives.

## Required PRs

These required PRs have all been merged.

* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/68~~
* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/91~~

## Testing

1. Run the shapes world: `ign-gazebo-server -r -f shapes.world -v 4`
2. Call the model info service: 

```
ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 2000 --req 'data: "box"'
```

content.html:
Do you have the correct ign-physics branch installed. I see the following output:

name: "box"
id: 7
pose {
  position {
    x: 1.801531057113717e-22
    y: 1.783520942858722e-22
    z: 0.49999999996325012
  }
  orientation {
    w: 1
  }
}
bounding_box {
  min_corner {
    x: -0.5
    y: -0.5
    z: -3.6749880916175925e-11
  }
  max_corner {
    x: 0.5
    y: 0.5
    z: 0.99999999996325006
  }
}

content.raw: That matches what I'm getting locally, including the `Pos().Z()` failures
content.html: That matches what I'm getting locally, including the Pos().Z() failures

content.html:
Not sure if my workspace is in a bad state, but I'm getting an invalid box for the box in the shapes world and the test is failing, is it currently working for you?

$ ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 300 --req 'data: "box"'
name: "box"
id: 7
pose {
  position {
    z: 0.5
  }
  orientation {
    w: 1
  }
}
bounding_box {
  min_corner {
    x: 1.7976931348623157e+308
    y: 1.7976931348623157e+308
    z: 1.7976931348623157e+308
  }
  max_corner {
    x: -1.7976931348623157e+308
    y: -1.7976931348623157e+308
    z: -1.7976931348623157e+308
  }
}

content.raw:
> SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model.

I haven't looked into the subt code, but another approach to handling this could be to write an Ignition Gazebo system that lives in the SubT repo and has access to the ECM and thus can get the AABB components directly. This way you avoid publishing the bounding box data over the wire.
content.html:
SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model.

I haven't looked into the subt code, but another approach to handling this could be to write an Ignition Gazebo system that lives in the SubT repo and has access to the ECM and thus can get the AABB components directly. This way you avoid publishing the bounding box data over the wire.

content.raw:
We recently added a [non-const Data()](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/650f5e3ca384c26734023f8798e235c758feb762/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Component.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Component.hh-351) function, so I think this could be simplified to something like:

`_ecm.Component<components::AxisAlignedBoundingBox>(_parent->Data())->Data() += boundingBox;`

But you may want to check if `modelBoundingBox` is not null just to be safe, any system can remove any component at any time.
content.html:
We recently added a non-const Data() function, so I think this could be simplified to something like:

_ecm.Component<components::AxisAlignedBoundingBox>(_parent->Data())->Data() += boundingBox;

But you may want to check if modelBoundingBox is not null just to be safe, any system can remove any component at any time.

content.raw: For now, a small optimization could be done by creating the AABB component in the `SceneBroadcaster` system, so if that system is not loaded, the component is not present and the physics doesn't handle it.
content.html: For now, a small optimization could be done by creating the AABB component in the SceneBroadcaster system, so if that system is not loaded, the component is not present and the physics doesn't handle it.

update.description:
I just need to add a test.

## Purpose

SubT needs to get bounding box information for the comms model. It only needs bounding box information at the model level. This PR *should* handle both link and model bounding boxes.

What I'm most unhappy about is the calculation of bounding information every iteration. We can live with this for the Acropolis release, but I'm open to other alternatives.

## Required PRs

These required PRs are also works in progress.

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/68
* ~~#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/91~~

## Testing

1. Run the shapes world: `ign-gazebo-server -r -f shapes.world -v 4`
2. Call the model info service: 

```
ign service -s /world/shapes/model/info --reqtype ignition.msgs.StringMsg --reptype ignition.msgs.Model --timeout 2000 --req 'data: "box"'
```
